BBT.body: On Aug. 1, 2015, $BBT completed the acquisition of $SUSQ, a banking holding company that contributed approx. $150MM in revenues.
$BBT's average loans held for investment were $130.5Bil, up $10.6Bil vs. 2Q15. Excluding $SUSQ & $BKYF, average loans were up $976MM.
Excluding $77MM of pretax merger-related and restructuring charges, $BBT's adjusted diluted EPS was $0.70, up an annualized 5.7% vs. 2Q15.
$BBT announced an agreement to acquire National Penn Bancshares which has $9.6Bil in assets, $6.7Bil in deposits and a 124 branches.
$BBT's mortgage banking income dipped $19MM reflecting lower net mortgage service rates income & decrease in commercial mortgage volume.
$BBT's non-interest expenses, $1.6Bil. Excluding merger-related charges & 2Q15 loss on early extinguishment of debt, expenses were up 4.2%
